content.description: Still dirty but it will clean up nicely. Protection isn't obvious or abundant but is there when you need it. Fun climb
content.protection: Doubles finger sized through #2 BD, might use a #3. Small to medium nuts. Two bolt anchor on top.
content.location: On face to right of Eye of Mordor Spire. Ascends crack system approximately 20 feet right of Necromancer - straight up then angling slightly right to anchor.

content.description: Well featured but overhanging the whole way. Use facing wall to stem if you want but there's no way out of the pumpy nature of this route. Cruxy finish.
content.location: On Eye of Mordor spire, around right side on arete right next to chimney.

climbs.name: Eye of Sauron
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Michael Genovese, Michael Elias

content.description: On the largest of semi-detached spires in Mordor rests the Eye of Sauron. It's watching you, and it is said that few can endure it's terrible gaze.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: Largest of the semi=detached spires in the area with rounded, "eye" boulder on top.

climbs.name: Ephel Dúath
climbs.fa: FA Cory Talman 2019, FFA Scott Duemler, Rachel Hall 10/21

content.description: Awkward start into easy hand crack in closed book with ample pro if needed. Onto ledge then slightly right up finger crack, past Awkward mantle then cool traverse right on jug to great hand jam and ledge, clip bolt then juggy face to 2 bolt anchor. Funner than it looks.
content.location: On the elfs ear spire, front/ creek side of the formation. For lower hand crack a #1, for upper section bring a singles .2 through .75,  single #2.. Bring a few Alpine runners to extend due to right traversing nature of path.

content.description: This is where the great rings of power were forged, and maybe you will forge something of your own here. Starts in a corner after you battle a few blackberry thorns. The corner is shallow, and the rock surprisingly insecure for the area. Pro is acceptable but not obvious or frequent. The physical crux is down low, the psychological crux is moving over an insecure bulge toward uninspiring protection.
content.protection: Doubles from .3 through 2 BD,one #3 nuts, a few extenders.
content.location: To climbers right of Eye of Sauron in corner with semi-obvious crack system to two bolt anchor.

content.description: Looks like an easy cruise but it's thin in spots and the exposure keeps it interesting. Great views and a very aesthetic location.
content.location: On Elf's Ear Spire, which looks like its name suggests. Furthest spire to right in Mordor. The Black Gate is the line of bolts up the slabby face to top.

content.description: Surrounded by cliffs of dark quartz, long ago slain by the unrelenting river, Morder waits with secrets. Angry briers are unrelenting and thirsty, but the cold crystalline water will carry your fears away. When affronted, the scaling cliffs fall toward you in huge spears of stone, frozen in place and waiting for eternity. You are not eternity, but you will try to slay them nonetheless. The spires and angry walls are ready, but by nature want to spit you out.         Bring your metal and your rope, but most of all some sturdy friends. You seek strength and beauty, with the threat of death. It is what we do, and this is where it is found.
